infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
extends ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

    Computes the differential conditional mutual information of two multivariate double[][] sets of observations, conditioned on another (implementing ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see references below) algorithm 2. Most of the functionality is defined by the parent class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    Crucially, the calculation is performed by examining neighbours in the full joint space rather than two MI calculators. This is roughly as specified by Frenzel and Pompe (who only specified this for algorithm 1), but mathematically adapted to algorithm 2 by Wibral et al. (see below).

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, and expanded on in ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    References:

    • M. Wibral, R. Vicente, and M. Lindner, "Transfer Entropy in Neuroscience", in "Directed Information Measures in Neuroscience", Understanding Complex Systems series, edited by M. Wibral, R. Vicente, and J. T. Lizier (Springer, Berlin/Heidelberg, 2014) pp. 3--36.
    • Frenzel and Pompe, "Partial Mutual Information for Coupling Analysis of Multivariate Time Series", Physical Review Letters, 99, p. 204101+ (2007).
    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www), Ipek Ã–zdemir

    • Method Detail

      • partialComputeFromObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromObservations(int startTimePoint,
                                      int numTimePoints,
                                      boolean returnLocals)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data.

        The method returns:

        1. for average conditional MIs (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_{xz}), digamma(n_{yz}) and digamma(n_z) for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local conditional MIs (returnLocals == true), the array of local conditional MI values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromObservations in class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of the relevant sum of digamma(n_xz+1) and digamma(n_yz+1) and digamma(n_z), then sum of n_xz, n_yz, n_z and for algorithm 2 only, sum of 1/n_xz and 1/n_yz (these latter five are only for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
